intro: Hieracium pseudocrassiceps, commonly known as the giant hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring dark green, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense, flat clusters, attracting various pollinators. However, it is considered an invasive species in some regions due to its rapid spread and competitive growth.
